summary: The Transportation Freedom Act primarily addresses fuel efficiency and emissions standards for vehicles. It proposes an enhanced tax deduction for wages paid to automobile manufacturing workers, contingent on meeting specific criteria. The bill also seeks to repeal existing multipollutant emissions standards, CAFE standards, and eliminate vehicle emission waivers. Furthermore, it mandates the establishment of new CAFE and greenhouse gas emissions standards for passenger and heavy-duty vehicles, and authorizes appropriations. The bill includes provisions for consultation with stakeholders and adjustments to standards based on market conditions, with deemed compliance clauses for manufacturers.
